The Chief Executive Election (Amendment) Bill 2010 and the Legislative Council (Amendment) Bill 2010 were introduced into LegCo on 10 December 2010. The House Committee agreed to form a Bills Committee to study the two Bills. The CE Election (Amendment) Bill 2010 sought to increase the number of seats for each EC sector to 300, allocate the additional seats among the EC subsectors and make changes in relation to DCs and Chinese medicine subsectors and other related matters. The LegCo (Amendment) Bill 2010 sought to enlarge LegCo by adding five geographical constituency seats and creating a new DC Functional Constituency (i.e. the DC (second) FC) of five seats and to make other changes related to LegCo elections.

The Bills Committee held a total of 11 meetings and received views from 78 organizations and individuals. The Bills Committee reported its deliberations to the House Committee on 18 February 2011. The Bills Committee made a report to the Council on 2 March 2011. The two bills were passed by LegCo on 3 March and 5 March 2011 respectively. [Meeting schedules] [Report]

The Government introduced the Maximum Amount of Election Expenses (Chief Executive Election) (Amendment) Regulation 2016, proposing that, the election expenses limit for the Chief Executive ("CE") election will be increased from $13 million to $15.7 million starting from the fifth-term CE election in March 2017. The House Committee did not form a subcommittee to scrutinize the subsidiary legislation.

The subsidiary legislation was tabled at LegCo on 24 February 2016 for negative vetting. The subsidiary legislation came into operation on 15 April 2016.
